description: This is Life is a fun, interactive and conversational podcast where we discuss real issues with a positive and wholesome perspective. Engage with Cornelius and Heather during their special segment, "Ask the Lindseys," where you can ask real questions and receive real answers. We’re talking about everyday issues that affect everyday people with personal insight and our own mix of straight-talk and humor. New episodes every Friday morning. Hope you join us! Subscribe today!

items.title: Marriage Advice Through the Years

items.content:
This week Heather and Cornelius talk about the arguments they’ve had in their marriage. They discuss many of the mistakes they’ve made. They talk about how they’ve learned to converse with each other without hitting below the belt. If you and your partner can’t communicate, LISTEN TO THIS TOGETHER. It’s funny and enlightening.

items.title: Arguing vs Constructive Communication in Marriage

items.content:
Heather and Cornelius celebrated 13 years of marriage recently and they are back to talk about the last couple years of their marriage. They talk about expectations, learning how to converse with each other, dealing with inner trauma, deciding not to get divorced, learning how to trust again and so much more. Whether you're married, engaged, dating or living single in these streets, there's something for you.

items.title: When Marriage Counseling Starts Hurting Your Relationship

items.content:
Cornelius and Heather continue their marriage discussion. This week they talk about losing control and stop treating your spouse like a child. They talk about submission and what’s really causing the control issues. This is one episode you want to listen with your spouse, person you’re dating or that friend you have your eye on. This is a great date night podcast.

items.title: Why He Got Off Social Media

items.content:
Holidays can be difficult. Sitting around the table with family you dislike is highly likely. There’s at one uncle that loves to talk about politics, the bougie aunt who looks down on everyone and everything, the cousin that cannot get his/her life together, the cousin who’s still searching for identity and the family secrets that lurk in the background. Listen as Cornelius and Heather talk about all this and more in this special holiday episode.

items.title: Lindseys in Israel

items.content:
Keke Palmer has questions for days, about everything under the sun. From the existential to the inconsequential. From pop culture to pop science. From the meaning of life to the meaning of W.A.P. From life in outer space to “Where the eff is Tom from MySpace?“ And everything in between. Because Baby, this is Keke Palmer, and she is here for All. Of. It.

Each week, the multi-talented Keke is taking you on a journey down the rabbit hole on a topic that she cannot stop obsessing over. She’ll also get deep with special guests, trying to answer the questions that keep us up at night. We are getting INTO IT.

Listen to Baby, this is Keke Palmer Only on Amazon Music:
www.amazon.com/BTIKP_us_pfd_AA_110122

items.title: Don't Give Up!

items.content:
When Emily Gellis hears rumors of people suffering horrible side effects from a trendy diet she springs into action. Armed with over a hundred thousand Instagram followers, Emily launches a social media crusade to expose F-Factor and its founder, Tanya Zuckerbrot. It’s the start of a feud that will attract trolls, lawyers, and, eventually, national media all because of fiber. From Wondery, this is a story about wealth, wellness, and influence hosted by Casey Wilson.

Listen to Fed Up: wondery.fm/LWTL_FedUp

items.content:
In today’s inaugural Season two episode, Lauren is inviting on psychotherapist and New York Times bestselling author of Maybe You Should Talk to Someone, Lori Gottlieb! The two dive in right away as Lauren asks Lori if she always envisioned being a counselor and how to create incredible connections with others through storytelling and music. The pair also chat about: what Lori believes drives the narrative of isolation, Lauren’s personal story with counseling and mental health, how to identify what ‘wise compassion’ is, the difference between productive anxiety vs unproductive anxiety, and exactly where to start to breed more compassion. If you’re ready to understand a little more about yourself, and those around you, to ultimately cultivate deeper relationships - this episode is for you. In addition to her clinical practice, Lori writes The Atlantic’s weekly “Dear Therapist” advice column and is co-host of the popular “Dear Therapists” podcast produced by Katie Couric.



Listen here: wondery.fm/Lindseys_DaigleBites

items.content:
A big Halloween party at an apartment complex in Redmond, Washington. Themed rooms and costumed partygoers. But by the end of the party, one of the hosts is dead. The police look to the partiers as the prime suspects: was it the guy in the devil mask, the bank robber, the construction worker? As investigators comb through forensic evidence, witness testimony, DNA, and even consult with a psychic, they zero in on one suspect in particular. But for what reason? Host and reporter Matthew Shaer (Over My Dead Body) returns to the scene of the crime, speaks with everyone about a night that still haunts them years later. It’s a series about race and policing, mislaid justice, cutting-edge science, and the kinds of weighty choices that cops and prosecutors make every day -- choices that, once made, are difficult to reverse.



Listen to SUSPECT: http://wondery.fm/Suspect_LifeLindseys

items.content: There's so much celebrity gossip that it's impossible to keep up. From the twists and turns of #FreeBritney to the latest Royal family dust-up, there’s a new podcast that has you covered. From Wondery, RICH AND DAILY delivers laughs and all the latest celebrity gossip. Hosts Brooke and Aricia are comedians, besties and the perfect guides to give you your daily dose of pop culture. They'll keep you up to speed on all of the secrets, scandals, and news in the entertainment world. Is that rumor you heard about Rihanna true? If it is, you better believe Brooke and Aricia will have something to say about it. This is just a preview of Rich and Daily, but you can listen to full episodes at http://wondery.fm/RD_LifeWithLindseys.

This is just a preview of Rich and Daily, but you can listen to full episodes at http://wondery.fm/RD_LifeWithLindseys.

You're worth it!

items.content: REDFLAGS. We all have them. And when someone crosses those things we believe we absolutely can not put up with, we immediately want to throw them away. The truth of the matter is, we grow, we learn, and we change. Listen in to this week’s episode of Life With the Lindsey’s as Cornelius and Heather stress the importance of embracing what’s different or even difficult. What appears to be unbearable or unattractive now could very well be a blessing!

Also, stay tuned to the end for an exciting and spontaneous interview featuring Logan and Taylor Lindsey!

items.content:
Whether we want to accept it or not, the developing outcomes of Coronavirus are affecting each of us. Many of us are being forced to spend more time at home, work from home, step in as teacher for our children, assess our businesses and different ways we can make up for lost income, and more - all of which have called us to create a new normal in our lives. Listen as Cornelius and Heather talk about the importance of using this as an opportunity to examine our hearts, to draw nearer to the Father, to get more involved with family and loved ones, and more!

Whatever you focus on will become your reality. If you focus on the reports of the news then you’ll be filled with fear. And you’ll feel alone, scared and abandoned if you’re without a proper covering. When you’re scared, you’re either not covered or don’t understand how you’re being covered. Listen as Cornelius and Heather talk about the importance of being covered and never being afraid.

items.content:

The goal is to discover a happy middle point of contentment so bad days don't break you and good days don't make you. Heather and Cornelius answer the age-old question: "How do I trust when I don't understand?" With life hitting us in every direction, we oftentimes don't know what to do. Join them as they tell you how to trust when you don't understand.

Breaking up can be hard to do. Some situations warrant it, but there are times when we fail to realize just how afraid we are of truly committing ourselves to a relationship. Listen as the Lindseys share their story on what led to them breaking up a month after they started courting. They also share some tips on noticing red flags, healing after breaking up and knowing when to ask for forgiveness after ending a relationship prematurely.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Most singles feel like marriage is their graduation. But what if being single is meant to be enjoyed? Join Heather & Cornelius Lindsey as they talk about being single and unsatisfied. They share personal and transparent stories from their single life. Their goal is to remind you that you have a purpose in this season and you are not alone!

items.title: Meet the Lindseys

items.content:
In marriage, there can exist three kinds of rings--an engagement ring, a wedding ring and suffering. Unfortunately, more and more couples are experiencing a great deal of suffering. In this episode, we share our personal marriage story. We share some things that we've never shared publicly before. Ultimately, everyone from singles to married couples will get something out of this because we've all felt the sting of unsatisfaction. Singles can learn some things about marriage and married folks can be encouraged through our honesty.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content: This is Life is a fun, interactive and conversational podcast where we discuss real issues with a positive and wholesome perspective. Engage with Cornelius and Heather during their special segment, "Ask the Lindseys," where you can ask real questions and receive real answers. We’re talking about everyday issues that affect everyday people with personal insight and our own mix of straight-talk and humor. New episodes every Friday morning. Hope you join us! Subscribe Today!
